title: mpich non-functional when relocated from build cache with relative paths

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body: I've got a situation where `mpich` is non-functional if 1. `mpich` binary cache was created using `-r` flag to `spack buildcache create` 2. `mpich` is installed from the binary cache into an `install_tree` which differs from where it was originally built **The problem seems to be tied to having cached `mpich` with `spack buildcache create -r`** I'm using: * `spack@develop` (ac7c69e62e61b0a45344690a8ede29f064f8fed5 from `2020-09-25`) * `Ubuntu 18.04` for `x86_64` * `mpich@3.2.1~wrapperrpath%gcc@7.5.0` 1. Build `mpich` from source, into a longer install_tree: ``` $> spack config edit config set `config: install_tree: /super/absurdly/ridiculously/obnoxiously/long/path/for/relocation` ``` ``` $> spack install --no-cache mpich@3.2.1~wrapperrpath target=x86_64 %gcc@7.5.0 OK ``` 2. Create a binary cache of `mpich` on local filesystem; use `-r` flag ``` $> spack buildcache create -afr --key -d mpich OK ``` 3. Change the install_tree ``` $> spack config edit config delete the `config: install_tree:` setting ``` 4. Install `mpich` from build cache ``` $> spack mirror add local / OK $> spack install --cache-only mpich@3.2.1~wrapperrpath target=x86_64 OK ``` 5. Observe non-functional `mpich` ``` $> spack load mpich $> mpiexec --version mpiexec: relocation error: mpiexec: symbol pthread_seta��Q�lU version GLIBC_2.3.4 not defined in file libpthread.so.0 with link time reference $> ldd `which mpiexec.hydra` ldd: exited with unknown exit code (139) ``` I do not see this problem if the `mpich` cache was originally created *without `-r` flag* @gartung @scottwittenburg @shahzebsiddiqui @tgamblin @becker33 @alalazo
